April 8, 1969
Mr. John W. Macy, Jr.
President, Corporation for Public Broadcasting
1250 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Mr. Macy:
Reaction to the March 20-21 meeting of the CPB
Radio Advisory committee has been affirmative.
On behalf of the National Educational Radio
Board of Directors, I am writing to express
appreciation for establishing the committee
and for bringing the group together so that
those actively engaged in the management of
educational radio stations might assist CPB
as it develops plans for educational radio.
Bob Swezey and Don Quayle are to be commended
for the excellent fashion in which the
sessions were handled. The free and frank
exchange of information was, I wwwume, helpÂ¬
ful to the corporation staff.
Though the nature of the meeting was
essentially exploratory, it seems to me that
some tentative directions were indicated.
Some items the corporation might consider
would include:
1. The identification of a person who would
serve as CPB's staff representative for
educational radio.
2. The activation of a radio news and public
affairs bureau in Washington, D.C..
Such a bureau co&ld be joined with a
television service.
3. The development of facilities providing
for live interconnected radio broadcasts
on a daily basis.
